byline.contributor: Hervé Taoko reported from Ouagadougou, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By HERVÉ TAOKO and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Guards seize Burkina Faso's interim president Michel Kafando, Prime Min Isaac Zida and two cabinet ministers in apparent military coup; event occurs less than year after country's last power upheaval.
lead_paragraph: Guards held the president, prime minister and two Cabinet members hostage, less than a year since the last abrupt power grab in the African country.

headline.main: Guards Seize Interim Leaders of Burkina Faso, and Gunfire Is Heard
headline.print_headline: Signs of Coup Shake Up Burkina Faso

snippet: Guards held the president, prime minister and two Cabinet members hostage, less than a year since the last abrupt power grab in the African country.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
